Issues.Title: [Patch port] fix(core): resolve forward-referenced host directives during directive matching
Issues.Body:
**Note:** this is a patch port of #58492.

When the compiler generates the `HostDirectivesFeature`, it generates either an eager call (`…µ…µHostDirectivesFeature([])`) or a lazy call (`…µ…µHostDirectivesFeature(() => [])`. The lazy call is necessary when there are forward references within the `hostDirectives` array. Currently we resolve the lazy variant when the component definition is created which has been enough for most cases, however if the host is injected by one of its host directives, we can run into a reference error because DI is synchronous and the host's class hasn't been defined yet.

These changes resolve the issue by pushing the lazy resolution later during directive matching when all classes are guanrateed to exist.

Fixes #58485.

`, imports: [ParentComponent, ChildDirective], }) export class AppComponent {} ``` App imported Parent and Child. This is ChildDirective. ``` import { Directive, inject } from '@angular/core'; import { ParentComponent } from './parent.component'; @Directive({ selector: '[appChild]', standalone: true }) export class ChildDirective { constructor() { console.log(inject(ParentComponent, { optional: true, self: true })); } } ``` Child imported Parent. This is ParentComponent ``` @Component({ selector: 'app-parent', template: `

parent works!

`, standalone: true, hostDirectives: [ChildDirective] }) export class ParentComponent {} ``` Parent imported Child (Circular References) Test run... ng serve --open ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d19c17d8-c67b-429f-b4cb-3e561af1dda3) so far everything good. parent works!

`, standalone: true, hostDirectives: [forwardRef(() => ChildDirective)] // <-- like this }) export class ParentComponent {} ``` same error... ### Check out the source code manual compile `yarn run ngc -p tsconfig.json` ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4e69118d-cf4f-4e97-b3ee-6c3a708c98e1) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ba6785ae-a551-49ba-ba80-44d455e200dd) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4705a758-d3c2-4fa4-80e3-9e91b92dc7de) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cb0e6e19-5c4d-419f-b8fa-35b0f285eafc) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d2c52043-e973-4aac-ad82-1278422fb034) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ef8270a4-99d4-4fcb-b861-b0a85b6e5e4a) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a2dfdca5-936b-4393-a7fb-86e89223efd3) Looking at the source code, Angular seems to handle forwardRef, but the whole process is indeed executed in a synchronous context. Issues.Title: Ability to set default component Change detection strategy
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

A common scenario is to have an application where all components use `ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush`

This requires importing `ChangeDetectionStrategy` from `@angular/core`, and adding the line `changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` in  component declarations.

This process is repeated in every component in the application.

### Proposed solution

Allow a configuration to set the default change detection strategy, for example by introducing a `withChangeDetectionStrategy(strategy)` function for the configuration.

This would remove a lot of boilerplate code in every component.

We can configure CLI to add this line when creating new components, but some of us do not use the CLI to generate components, and it would still generate boilerplate code, making component code more cluttered.


### Alternatives considered

Apologies if this is already possible, for example by setting the ChangeDetectionStrategy in the `Root` component. But it is my impression that currently we have to set it in every component.
